dt: {bc}a small particle of a burning substance thrown out by a body in combustion or remaining when combustion is nearly completed
{bc}a hot glowing particle struck from a larger mass
{bc}a luminous disruptive electrical discharge of very short duration between two conductors separated by a gas (such as air)
{bc}the mechanism controlling the discharge in a spark plug
{bc}something that sets off a sudden force

dt.t: provided the {wi}spark{/wi} that helped the team to rally

dt: {bc}a latent particle capable of growth or developing {bc}{sx|germ||}

ins.spl: plural in form but singular in construction

et: Middle English {it}sparke{/it}, from Old English {it}spearca{/it}; akin to Middle Dutch {it}sparke{/it} spark and perhaps to Latin {it}spargere{/it} to scatter
shortdef: a small particle of a burning substance thrown out by a body in combustion or remaining when combustion is nearly completed
a hot glowing particle struck from a larger mass; especially : one heated by friction
a luminous disruptive electrical discharge of very short duration between two conductors separated by a gas (such as air)

dt: {bc}to set off in a burst of activity {bc}{sx|activate||}

shortdef: to flash or fall like sparks
to produce sparks; specifically : to have the electric ignition working
Dame Muriel (Sarah) 1918—2006 née Camberg British writer

dt: {bc}a device usually used to detect the path of a high-energy particle that consists of a series of charged metal plates or wires separated by a gas (such as neon) in which observable electric discharges follow the path of the particle

shortdef: a device usually used to detect the path of a high-energy particle that consists of a series of charged metal plates or wires separated by a gas (such as neon) in which observable electric discharges follow the path of the particle

dt: {bc}a space between two high-potential terminals (as of an induction coil or spark plug) through which pass discharges of electricity

shortdef: a space between two high-potential terminals (as of an induction coil or spark plug) through which pass discharges of electricity; also : a device having a spark gap

dt: {bc}a part that fits into the cylinder head of an internal combustion engine and carries two electrodes separated by an air gap across which the current from the ignition system discharges to form the spark for combustion
{bc}one that initiates or gives impetus to an undertaking

shortdef: a part that fits into the cylinder head of an internal combustion engine and carries two electrodes separated by an air gap across which the current from the ignition system discharges to form the spark for combustion
one that initiates or gives impetus to an undertaking

dt: {bc}a person who says or does something that seems intelligent but is really not

dt.t: Who's the {it}bright spark{/it} who came up with this rotten idea?

shortdef: a person who says or does something that seems intelligent but is really not
